column4: can someone help me, my GLX driver setup seems to be broken. I've installed the Nvidia-glx driver, but it does not appear in 8.04's System > Administration > Hardware Drivers app, nor does xorg.conf seem to be configured for Nvidia drivers. glxinfo outputs  name of display: :0.0
Xlib:  extension "GLX" missing on display ":0.0".
Xlib:  extension "GLX" missing on display ":0.0".
Xlib:  extension "GLX" missing on display ":0.0".
etc
sudo nvidia-xconfig
did that, glxinfo gives same output
what GPU do you have?
the video card
lspci | grep VGA 01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation NV43 [GeForce 6200] (rev a2)
and you said you install nvidia-glx correct?
as far as I know, it's checked as installed in Add/Remove Programs app
hmm, try lsmod | grep nvidia and tell me if it lists anything
lsmod | grep nvidia returns nothing
the module is not being loaded, try cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver
tell me what that returns
Driver         "mouse"    Driver         "keyboard"    Driver         "nvidia"
try to install the propreitary driver and see if that helps.
forgive my noobiness, but how do I do that?

go to the nvidia website and download the linux driver for your card to your home directory, then ctrl+alt+f1 and login, sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop , sudo chmod +x NV* , sudo sh NV* , follow instructions onscreen.
once the install finished , sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start
alright I'll get on that, and see what happens, thx for help
no prob.
